content.html:
In this lesson, you learned how to:

  • Solve by completing the square when given a quadratic equation in which the coefficient of the squared term is 1.

Here are the activities that helped you reach those goals:

  • 9.3.1: Solving Equations with Fractions
    • In this activity, you mentally solved equations with fractions and exponents.
  • 9.3.2: Using Completing the Square to Solve Equations
    • In this activity, you solved quadratic equations involving rational numbers including decimals and fractions.
    • 9.3.2: Self Check
    • 9.3.2: Additional Resources
  • 9.3.3: Solve by Completing the Square
    • In this activity, you examined the steps to solving quadratic equations by completing the square and identified the step where an error occurred.
    • 9.3.3: Self Check
    • 9.3.3: Additional Resources
  • 9.3.4: Completing the Square with Fractions
    • In this activity, you showed how to get the given zeros of the quadratic by completing the square.

After these activities, you completed the following practice:

  • 9.3.5: Practice

Checking In

On a scale of 1 to 5, how confident do you feel about the learning goals of this lesson?

Correct!

If you’ve answered 3 or less, be sure to reach out to your teacher before starting the next lesson.
